Do relatives or associates need protection?

If you are concerned about the safety of {{theAggrieveds}} relatives or associates, you can include them on the application for protection.

An associate refers to a person in {{theAggrieveds}} life. For example, {{#if userIsAggrieved}}your{{else}}{{aggrievedTheir}}{{/if}} current partner, a person that works with {{#if userIsAggrieved}}you{{else}}{{aggrievedThem}}{{/if}}, a person that lives with {{#if userIsAggrieved}}you{{else}}{{aggrievedThem}}{{/if}}, or someone who gives {{#if userIsAggrieved}}you{{else}}{{aggrievedThem}}{{/if}} help and support.

  1. Do other people {{aggrievedYouKnow}} need protection from {{respondentName}}? Other people can include {{aggrievedYour}} family, relatives, friends, coworkers or other people {{aggrievedYouKnow}}. They are known as {{theAggrieveds}} associates.
